sen.j: 徳大寺 公迪（とくだいじ きんみち/きんなり、明和8年6月19日 (旧暦)（1771年7月30日） - 文化 (元号)8年7月25日 (旧暦)（1811年9月12日））は、江戸時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: Kinmichi TOKUDAIJI, also known as Kinnari TOKUDAIJI (July 30, 1771 - September 12, 1811), was a Court noble who lived during the late Edo period.
Kinmichi TOKUDAIJI who was also known as Kinnari TOKUDAIJI (July 30, 1771 - September 12, 1811) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: Kinmichi TOKUDAIJI who was also known as Kinnari TOKUDAIJI (July 30, 1771 - September 12, 1811) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 光格天皇（119代）の代に仕え、官位は正二位大納言まで進む。
sen.e: He served at the Imperial Court during the reign of Emperor Kokaku (the one hundred-nineteenth Japanese emperor), and his final official title was Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state) with the rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 原文に「大納言」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「権大納言」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: He served for the sovereign of the 119th Emperor Kokaku; He was promoted up to Shonii - "Gon Dainagon" (Senior Second Rank and Provisional Chief Councilor of State).
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: He served for the sovereign of the 119th Emperor Kokaku; He was promoted up to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon (Provisional Chief Councilor of State).
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。

sen.e: His father was Sanemi TOKUDAIJI.
His father was Sanemi TOKUDAIJI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His father was Sanemi TOKUDAIJI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His mother is unknown.
His mother is unknown.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His mother is unknown.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Sanetane IMADEGAWA.
His wife was a daughter of Sanetane IMADEGAWA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Sanetane IMADEGAWA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 養子に徳大寺実堅がいる。
sen.e: Sanemi TOKUDAIJI was his adoptive son.
Sanemi TOKUDAIJI was his adopted son.
sen.cmt: 用語を訂正しました。
sen.e: Sanemi TOKUDAIJI was his adopted son.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He was conferred a peerage in 1780.
He was conferred a peerage in 1780.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was conferred a peerage in 1780.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 以降累進して、近衛府や近衛府を経て、天明6年（1786年）に従三位となり公卿に列する。
sen.e: He was promoted afterward, and he ranked among Court nobles with the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1786 after he experienced Ukone no Gon no Shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Ukone no Gon no Chujo (Provisional Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 原文に「近衛府や近衛府」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「右近衛権少将や右近衛権中将」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Since then, he was successfully promoted; After he took the positions of "Ukone no Gon no Shosho" (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and "Ukone no Gon no Chujo" (Provisional Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1786, which gave him the title Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: Since then, he was successfully promoted; After he took the positions of Ukone no Gon no Shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Ukone no Gon no Chujo (Provisional Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1786, which gave him the title Kugyo.
sen.cmt: タイトルの"を削除しました。

sen.j: 寛政8年（1796年）には中納言となり、寛政10年（1798年）には中宮欣子内親王の中宮権大夫となった。
sen.e: He was appointed Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state) in 1796, and he became a Chugu Gon no Daibu (provisional master of the Consort's Household) of Imperial Princess Yoshiko, who was a Chugu (Imperial consort), in 1798.
sen.cmt: 原文に「中納言」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「権中納言」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: He was appointed "Gon Chunagon" (Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) in 1796; He became "Chugu Gon no Daibu" (Provisional Master of the Consort's Household) for Imperial Princess Yoshiko who was Chugu (Imperial consort) in 1798.
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: He was appointed Gon Chunagon (Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) in 1796; He became Chugu Gon no Daibu (Provisional Master of the Consort's Household) for Imperial Princess Yoshiko who was Chugu (Imperial consort) in 1798.
sen.cmt: タイトルの"を削除しました。

sen.j: 寛政12年（1800年）からは大納言となり、文化元年（1804年）から文化8年（1811年）にかけては後桜町上皇の院御厩別当となった。
sen.e: He was appointed Gon Dainagon in 1800 and he served as the chief of the In no Miumaya (a division which was responsible for looking after oxen and horses) from 1804 to 1811.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処原文に「大納言」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「権大納言」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: He took the position of "Gon Dainagon" in 1800; He served as the chief of "In no Miumaya" (the division which was responsible for looking after oxen and horses) for the retired emperor Gosakuramachi from 1804 to 1811.
sen.cmt: 後桜町上皇の訳抜けです。定訳を追加しました。他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: He took the position of Gon Dainagon in 1800; He served as the chief of In no Miumaya (the division which was responsible for looking after oxen and horses) for the retired emperor Gosakuramachi from 1804 to 1811.
sen.cmt: タイトルの"を削除しました。

sen.j: 文化2年（1805年）には踏歌節会内弁をつとめる。
sen.e: He also served as a Toka no sechie Geben (Court noble who conducted a Toka no Sechie [a ceremony held at the Imperial Court in January] inside the Jomei Gate) in 1805.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He served as "Toka no sechie Geben" (Court Noble who conducted a Toka no Sechie [a ceremony held at the Imperial Court in January] inside the Jomei Gate) in 1805.
sen.cmt: Toka no sechie Gebenからaをとり、""をつけました。Alsoを削除しました。
sen.e: He served as Toka no sechie Geben (Court Noble who conducted a Toka no Sechie [a ceremony held at the Imperial Court in January] inside the Jomei Gate) in 1805.
sen.cmt: タイトルの"を削除しました。

sen.j: 香川景樹に師事して和歌を学んだ。
sen.e: He learned Waka (Japanese poetry) from Kageki KAGAWA.
He learned Waka (Japanese poetry) which was taught by Kageki KAGAWA.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に訂正しました。
sen.e: He learned Waka (Japanese poetry) which was taught by Kageki KAGAWA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
